Online safety: Children may be exposed to inappropriate content or predators online, which can lead to emotional distress and even physical harm.
Cyberbullying: Children may be targets of cyberbullying, which can have serious consequences for their mental and emotional well-being.
Addiction: Children may become addicted to digital devices and online activities, leading to negative impacts on their academic performance, social relationships, and overall health.
Privacy concerns: Children may not be aware of the importance of protecting their personal information online, which can lead to identity theft and other privacy-related issues.

Digital divide: Children from low-income families may not have access to the same digital resources as their peers, which can create a digital divide and exacerbate existing social and economic inequalities.
